body: Done! Thanks. Don't know when or why we changed everything though...

> Done! Thanks. Don't know when or why we changed everything though...

This happened between v3.2.1 and v3.3:
- https://cryptography.io/en/3.2.1/hazmat/primitives/asymmetric/rsa/
- https://cryptography.io/en/3.3/hazmat/primitives/asymmetric/rsa.html

FWIW it is possible to put this setting into https://github.com/pyca/cryptography/blob/main/.readthedocs.yml so that it's better documented as a code. Example: https://github.com/cherrypy/cheroot/blob/473c546/.readthedocs.yml#L11.
The plot thickens. Our config on RTD: So we're building html but our config says htmldir still.

I bet this is .readthedocs.yml overriding teh web UI.

On Sun, Mar 7, 2021 at 2:57 PM Paul Kehrer <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> The plot thickens. Our config on RTD:
> [image: image]
> <https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/161495/110252849-051e1900-7f4d-11eb-9d82-3da71bb5c9cc.png>
> So we're building html but our config says htmldir still.
>
> â€”

-- 
All that is necessary for evil to succeed is for good people to do nothing.

> I bet this is .readthedocs.yml overriding teh web UI.

I've never seen unset `.readthedocs.yml` settings overriding the web UI but your guess sounds reasonable. It's worth reporting to https://github.com/readthedocs/readthedocs.org/issues.

issue.title: Configure ReadTheDocs to use the dirhtml builder
URLs with trailing slashes aren't working

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: A confirmed bug or unintended behavior

issue.body:
A recent build of the Twine docs [failed with this error](https://github.com/pypa/twine/runs/2319520105?check_suite_focus=true#step:5:222):

```
/home/runner/work/twine/twine/docs/changelog.rst.rst:5:broken link: https://packaging.python.org/guides/distributing-packages-using-setuptools/#pre-release-versioning (404 Client Error: Not Found for url: https://packaging.python.org/guides/distributing-packages-using-setuptools/)
```

At the moment, that URL shows the RTD "This page does not exist yet" error.

The same thing is happening on internal links in the docs, such as "An Overview of Packaging for Python" in the table of contents. The `href` is referencing `overview.html`, but clicking on the link results in a 301 redirect to `/overview/`, which results in a 404.

body: FTR this happened in another place and we confirmed that the config does indeed override the web UI: https://github.com/pypa/packaging.python.org/issues/876 / https://github.com/pypa/packaging.python.org/pull/877.

issue.title: Set `dirhtml` builder explicitly in the RTD config

repository.name: cryptography
repository.description: cryptography is a package designed to expose cryptographic primitives and recipes to Python developers.

issue.body:
After introducing the `.readthedocs.yml` config in the repo, it
started overriding all of the settings set via the RTD UI
unintentionally switching the URL scheme.

This change reverts that switch resurrecting the old one.

Fixes #5863

Refs:
* https://github.com/pyca/cryptography/issues/5863#issuecomment-817828152

issue.title: [BUG] Adding a partial `.readthedocs.yml` file overrides all of the settings set in the web UI

repository.name: readthedocs.org
repository.description: The source code that powers readthedocs.org

issue.body:
## Details

Recently, I observed at least two projects adding a minimalist `.readthedocs.yml` and not noticing immediately that the effective URL scheme has changed.

Here's some references:
* https://github.com/pyca/cryptography/issues/5863 / https://github.com/pyca/cryptography/pull/5964
* https://github.com/pypa/packaging.python.org/issues/876 / https://github.com/pypa/packaging.python.org/pull/877

What happened in both cases was that the projects have `dirhtml` builder set in the web UI but then, they wanted to _only_ change specific properties of the build envs (without touching other settings) so they added the following configs to their repos to do just chage:
```yaml
# .readthedocs.yml

version: 2

sphinx:
  configuration: source/conf.py

python:
  version: 3.8
```
```yaml
# .readthedocs.yml

version: 2

build:
  image: "7.0"
```

## Expected Result

`sphinx.builder` is unset so the implicit expectation was that the one set earlier in the web UI would still be used.

## Actual Result

`sphinx.builder` was set to `html` without any warnings/notifications.

## How to improve this

I think, there are a few things RTD could do to make this situation better:
1. Add a big red warning to https://docs.readthedocs.io/en/stable/config-file/v2.html explaining how this works.
2. Print out an explanation on how the config is constructed to the build logs.
3. Merge the config file with the settings in the UI, overriding only specific options that have been explicitly requested via the config.
4. Or at least grey out all of the settings in the UI with an explanation that the config file in the repo now controls those and UI changes are disabled.
